title: Bar experience only but loved it
text:
So loved this atmosphere and so have to go back for dinner there.

Great negroni and absolutely loved the bar staff who were very efficient and friendly with a smile. Haven’t seen service like that for a long time in Australia

I will be calling - bar and food

title: Girls night out
text:
So nice for girls to chat and have some peace and great food . Some of the dishes appeared a tad contrived but for a one off meal like this we were ok with that.

Fabulous wine selection to die for

Service was good and not over the top

title: Great bar
text:
Wow stumbled across this and had a quick drink before dinner booking at another venue- place looked busy but was a Friday night so we believe you would need to book a table

Food looked great too

Loved the atmosphere. We will be back for a meal there

title: Fabulous food and service
text:
We were on a time limit due to a show at Her Majesty’s and the staff were amazing to ensure we had time to enjoy the meal and make the show.

The oysters in the coconut curry were out of this world we had to order another serve.

The spanner crab was so different, tasty and great element of spice. The octopus was tender and lovely spice to it

Fabulous wine selection by wait staff too.

Yes highly recommend and we will be back for more time so not so rushed

title: Excellent wines, attention to service and food
text:
Wow, a must visit - highly recommend as the staff know their wines and food, cocktails also amazing- service was knowledgeable and efficient without interfering in our night out so we could still talk.

Menu caters for all food likes, sharing plates also fabulous to relax over a meal and wine

Highly recommend this venue and I hope it doesn’t change as it gets complacent - as many venue do.

We will be back

title: Fabulous
text:
Very impressed with the food, service and location. Oh and the wines

We did the discovery meal and pairing wines and none of us were disappointed. Having said that we did find that maybe the 5 courses would have been enough as the 7 was very filling.

The wines were perfectly matched.

Yes I would go back if I lived in Auckland

title: Different
text:
Quite enjoyed this space - loved the 80’s decor but we sat outside as a gorgeous Saturday afternoon

It’s a visit once place (as I am from Australia) my Auckland friends always take me to different places

It’s worth a visit if you walk the Orakei Basin as we did

title: Fabulous spot to stop for a drink
text:
Friends live 500metres from here and very jealous. So we did a fabulous 10km walk on Saturday and wow did I want a drink on walk home. So why not right? Hot and sweaty the barman nailed it with serving us sloe gin sour - yum. So good we ordered a second one.

Pity we couldn’t settle in for the remainder of the afternoon

Will be back

title: Hidden gem in a country town
text:
Wow, what a find and completely unexpected as we hadn’t been to Maldon for a couple of years (or more time flies)

The gentleman behind the counter (I think owner) was so generous with his patience as I worked out what cheeses I wanted to eat with a lovely glass of wine.

He helped and offered suggestions and I wasn’t disappointed

Worth driving out of you way to spend time choosing and eating cheese with a lovely wine

title: Oh what a fab night
text:
Soooo many choices and not enough room in tummy to try them all.

Scared of food envy of others so why not go more than once. Anyhow, very well run, great Pimms bar and great Vietnamese

Also great dessert, pity there was no ice-kechang.....with Durian - yum

title: Nice lunch
text:
Cute venue, lovey menu, nice clean good, great service

Tables a bit tight so feels a bit claustrophobic

title: Very satisfying
text:
I was very surprised how good the food was here. Haven’t been a fan of the other sister restaurants.

Prawn souva was yum as was the chicken. Salad was fresh and tasty

Great wine list, mastiha on menu too

Service was excellent

Yeah I recommend Gazi

title: Fabulous
text:
Excellent - loved the atmosphere and fit out to start with.

Entree amazing had school prawns and kingfish to share - tasty tasty tasty

Rockling main was tasty and fresh with herbs and mints and noc nuam- good size meal too. Other party had sirloin and that was not disappointing at all as I had a taste.

Great wine list too

Reasonably priced and great service

Yep I will be back

title: Loved it
text:
Always concerned with Bridge Rd cafes these days, and stumbled across this one.

Excellent coffee and great breakfast selection. Citrus cured salmon was amazing - so tasty refreshing and light.

Great service

Clean cafe too which isn’t so common that end of bridge Rd as we walked in and out of 3 others before we dined here.

We will be back so yes we do recommend ducking in for a bite to eat

title: A must stay
text:
We stayed here 4 years ago for one night and loved it

Hasn’t changed - loved it and stayed 5 nights this time -

Staff are amazing, fabulous location being Oltrarno and away from tourist crowds, close to great restaurants, clean and quite

Fab housekeeping too

Yes highly recommend Palazzo Magnani Feroni

title: Great platters
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed a last minute let’s have a beer and platter....

Service was exceptional and plenty of love as the staff prepared our platter of cured meats and amazing cheese.

Very friendly place and would go back if we lived there
place: La Prosciutteria Crudi e Bollicine - Firenze

title: Loved it
text:
Thanks to our Bergamo tour guide we were taken to this place for lunch otherwise we would never have found it.

Our guide recommended the local ravioli which was sensational

Weather was great so eating outdoors was no issue. We were lucky we timed our arrival so that there was no wait for a table. Otherwise there was quite a wait for late comers

I do recommend that you support restaurant who support their community

title: Great
text:
We never eat near Duomo or Galleria as too touristy for us. However whenever I arrive in Milan I must see Duomo as soon as I can. And we were hungry so happy to drop into a table and eat

The vongole was fabulous and service was efficient and friendly

Would we eat there again, yes we would

title: Beyond expectations
text:
I guess you get what you pay for but in this instance you get more. The staff are amazing. They welcome you each time you walk by lobby. The staff at the bar are the same, always welcoming. Even door staff downstairs are amazingly friendly.

Additionally the staff were great in arranging skip the line tours and arranging a trip outside of Milano for the day. The staff arranged the day tour the night before which was a big ask during fashion week.

The room was a great size and housekeeping were also fabulous

Cocktails and food at bamboo bar was excellent.

So impressed we will be back and we can’t wait to see all the staff again

title: I guess it has to be done
text: I am wondering what the big deal is as I have seen some amazing sunsets many places around the world. Still trying to figure out why people line up for hours before hand to watch sunset and then clap when it’s done?????

title: Nice villa great sunset lovely staff
text:
Found the bed awkward being in tight corner of room with no window light and small access to bed. But it’s just to sleep right? Air conditioning didn’t quite make it to the bed area so found the night time sleeps a tad warm and uncomfortable

However the staff made up for the bed issue as they were so accomodating and even housekeeping was a lovely young lass who did a fabulous job and with such a lovely smile.

I am not a fan of Santorini as I found it with too many people and too far up from the water as I love to be in the water not look at it.

However if you are a fan of Santorini I would recommend Fanari Villas

title: Food tour was with Carolina
text:
Wow, what a day. Carolina is so passionate and knows her city so well.

I lost count on different items we tasted but the outstanding was the yoghurt (sheeps milk) with honey and walnuts. So memorable I hope to find same back in Melbourne.

The spoon desserts with coffee were also memorable and I will try to get recipe for the spiced walnuts - so yum.

The whole day was super and I would do that tour again. Well worth a great way to see Athens too - and Carolina is a delight

title: Love the Plaka
text: Ok might be touristy but I loved it and I believe all visitors would too. There are loads of hidden treasures to be found at Plaka so enjoy and find your own

title: It’s gotta be done
text:
Well luckily end of August so but so hot but still hot for many people. Wear a hat

Enjoyable but for people pushing and shoving to get best selfie photos. Pity people don’t live in the moment

But one has to visit this right?

title: Wow fabulous place
text:
I so will be back next year to Athens and so will book Electra Metropolis Hotel

The staff are amazing and can’t do enough for you

The room was clean and bright

The breakfast buffet is spoilt for choice and loved it - again staff amazing

The pool is so welcoming after a long day of sight seeing in the Athens heat.

Again the rooftop staff were welcoming and accomodating at all visits

I would highly recommend this great hotel also in a great location

title: OMG the best
text:
This was amazing. Loved every bit of it was a great memory for me

I wish I could visit this spring every week and envy those who live nearby

Highly recommend this experience

title: Nice hotel
text:
I liked the bright rooms and great views from terrace balcony

I liked hearing the goats in the morning with their bells on

Breakfast buffet very mediocre.

No complaints but no amazing memory of this hotel either - so average rating from me

title: Great service
text:
We were on a tour so no choice of booking hotels. This was a fabulous choice. Loved being near the beach.

Lovely water views too.

The manager and staff were amazing and went beyond call of duty as I was really sick with flu

The breakfast choices were fabulous. I can see how families with kids would be beside themselves with the choice of kids activities too.

I would return here and I would highly recommend this resort.

title: Great pizza and atmosphere
text:
The reviews here were accurate - quirky venue with great pizzas and funny self serve.

We loved it and clearly many do as it was pumping - I would highly recommend eating pizza here

title: Amazing works on display
text: But we expect the art work to be amazing. The crowds drove me mad - fear of missing out (fomo) is driving me to distraction at these galleries with people pushing and shoving and right on your back. So I didn’t enjoy the viewing of the amazing artwork that I had thought I would- so it’s my issue and i will work on that. But be prepared for people encroaching on your space

title: A must visit
text:
What a perfect find and luckily 1.00pmish so we scored a table on a busy Sunday afternoon.

The waiter was very professional and gracious. The menu was amazing and I hadn’t had any steak for a few weeks so the fillet was in order. Was cooked to perfection with fabulous salad.

For starters we shared salami and fig bread which was divine

Great wine too

Lovely atmosphere- well worth going to and perhaps make a reservation to be sure to get a table

title: Beyond expectations
text:
Well we didn’t realise how large this museum was, how far back technology and science it took us back to and where we are today and look at the future.

It’s a must visit. There is 12 acres of museum, we will return to the museum and allow at least half a day to enjoy in more detail and not so rushed

Allow at least half a day and enjoy
place: Museo Della Scienza E Della Tecnologia Leonardo da Vinci

title: Perfect lunch with a view
text:
We were recommended by our hotel to have lunch here. I first thought when we were seated with best view of Duomo that the food would be substandard- I was wrong

Service was amazing and the food was fresh and stunning and the wines to match was added bonus.

Deserts were also stunning particularly the Bomba.

I would recommend lunch here and enjoy the stunning view of duomo at same time

title: Very interesting
text:
Enjoyed visiting the gallery with much renaissance art work that we didn’t expect to see.

We found that the early start was great as we almost had the place to ourselves so try to get in at open times before the tours head in.

Enjoy the peace and quiet

title: Always a delight
text:
Been 4 years since we dined here and glad to see nothing has changed

The service is beyond expectations and the food is always fresh and beautifully presented.

Matched wines throughout the meal was catered for and our preference as we have no idea on Italian wines

We will be back

title: Overgrown unkept disappointing gardens
text:
The €10 should be spent on maintaining the gardens which need weeding or mowing, no plants to mention, some sculptures completely neglected and water features dirty and unkept.

Could be stunning if anyone cared as it appears no one spends any time maintaining what could be a fabulous feature.

The only wow factor was the views from the garden at the porcelain museum of the countryside outside of the gardens.

I would NOT recommend anyone waste their energy in hot Firenze weather to trek through a dusty garden

title: Loved it
text:
Disappointed at some of the reviews here. It is not fine dining and if you want menu’s in English, then dine the tourist side of the river and have hamburgers.

We found it fun trying to translate some of the menu, as some we understood. So stuck to the handwritten menu as that is the fresh specials and the pasta alla vongole was the best we have had. The prosciutto e melone was also fresh and refreshing.

Great prices and great home style cooking, service was ok and we have no gripes and will be back again

Please enjoy this special trattoria as we did

title: Speechless
text:
Sadly only a one night stay but a great introduction to Hydra - and I will be back

Hotel Leto is full of charm. Reception and courtyard is amazingly elegant and dreamy. I felt so lost in a different world.

Room was great size and what views.

Funnily enough it was the day/night of no power, which just added to the charm of how lovely the locals reacted to the issue. Made me realise how badly Australians would have behaved blaming hotel owners of lack of power, food, air con etc. We found it disappointing for businesses as they lost fresh produce and potential revenue.

So, Hotel Leto, and Hydra, see you next year. For more than one night and with power, very excited

title: Perfect location
text:
We stumbled across this fabulous restaurant and no complaints. Warm seafood salad was a hit and I thoroughly enjoyed basic risotto Milanese- followed by stunning mandarin sorbet.

Service was excellent

We will go back

title: Fabulous shopping
text:
For those quirky gifts for Christmas or birthdays this is definitely the place to buy. Browsing was so much fun and yes I did buy.

Books and kitchen wares were my favourites

Great unique products

title: Best bakery
text:
Have to say haven’t seen a bakery with such amazing products for a very very long time.

Pies were amazing. Cakes are beyond words - and too many to choose from

Coffee was fabulous

Atmosphere amazing in old mill

Highly recommend you all visit this bakery

title: Excellent last minute choice
text:
Been before and always been fabulous. This time was no exception -

Staff were fabulous, friendly and efficient

Food was amazing, lamb and sardines were tasty and steak was faultless

Will be back

title: Consistently fabulous
text:
Been many many times and always consistently fabulous food and service

I love how the menu changes so one never gets bored.

Food is always fresh, tasty and love the presentation

Great local wines too

Eat at the bar or tables - relaxed atmosphere adds to this being our favourite regular night out

title: Fabulous lunch
text:
We were recommended to go to Anchovy and we were not disappointed.

Menu was so interesting we shared 3 starters between the 2 of us, and then shared the garfish and sand crab with curry leaf and salted duck egg - to die for.

Waitress was fabulous and even suggested the matching wine which worked very well with all that we ate

Of I forgot the dessert - fermented rice cream, ginger granita and permission was an excellent palette cleanse - the ginger flavour lasted on my pallet for an hour.

We so will be back

title: Always a consistent favourite
text:
Just love the food here. Fresh and large variety - no favourite but for the jasmine tea a plenty

Lovely staff who demonstrated the right amount of attention

Always great value

Will be back

title: Fabulously consistent
text:
Great venue to have dinner with a beat friend - no pressure to leave after eaten.

Food always fresh and great variety

Staff provided correct amount of attention

Always fabulous value

Will be back

title: Lunch - lovely food and atmosphere
text:
Excellent food - freshly shucked oysters always a favourite. Scallops entree had amazing flavour and so fresh

Beef and lamb dishes were superbly cooked - meat falling apart on the fork. Flavour to expectation

Great wine menu

Lovely staff and gorgeous atmosphere

Will be back

title: Always a regular
text:
Great seafood - fabulous service

Either wet or cooked seafood, Peter sources the freshest and always reflective when eating their food.

Love the freshly shucked oysters when requested too

Been going for years and will continue to do so

title: New owners - fabulous
text:
Took a foodie friend for a quick lunch and was impressed with new decor, staff, smart aprons to give a great impression

Have to say best Chai Latte EVER.....

Late lunch to had the Dahl which was fabulously fresh and light. Friend had quiche who was very content

Love this icon and so pleased new professional and experienced owners to bring this old lady back to life

title: Great pub grub
text:
So nice to have a “pub” in Daylesford - so tired of dining out and pub food is needed and in demand in this town.

Love the Parma, steaks, pizzas and gnocchi - oh the nachos are best ever

A favourite occasional regular now

title: Too long a wait for food but yummy
text:
It was a Saturday morning and we did have to get to an open for inspection.

Service started quickly with great coffee but sadly the breakfast too far too long and did throw our day out.

The food was fabulous so can’t complain but we did notice all patrons waited a very long time for food. Perhaps that’s the Footscray way of life?

title: Upgraded to city suite
text:
Well I booked this because close to venue for a conference.

I am quite surprised at the warehouse conversion foyer and the staff were so friendly

I was upgraded and the 2 bedroom suite was beyond expectations. Great views of city, great living space with kitchenette, excellent size bedroom and wardrobe space

Very fashionable decor and fit out. Very well thought out. Loved it

Very quiet at night too. Slept well

Yes I will be back. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Fabulous food and service
text:
Loved the 5 course meal. Very interesting flavours (as expected) but also great size meals for a 5 course meal

Service was exceptional with every dish explained in detail and not overly done

Lovely atmosphere too.

Oh - and well priced and awesome wine list

A must visit - you won't regret it

title: Embarrassing- so awful on every item
text:
Seriously what has happened to Lygon St in recent years. Took friends from interstate to Lygon St and we chose Carmines

Started with odd tasting gin and tonic. Foul tasting whiskey too. We should have paid and left.

The food had odd taste too. All four of our dishes. The pasta was lacking something - can't pin point what. My husband had lamb shanks and he said it was horrible and didn't taste like lamb. The other person had schnitzel- dried and tasteless

Creme brulee was horrible and again had an odd taste to it.

None of our dishes were finished

Price was extremely high especially for the food quality

Restaurant was empty all night. As was Lygon St.

Keep away from Lygon St. Melbourne CBD has AMAZING Italian restaurants - don't waste your time here

title: Lovely rooftop for a Saturday afternoon
text:
Nice and quiet rooftop for a quiet drink. Lovely atmosphere

The girls behind the bar appear to have no experience though. She didn't know what Campari was and when I asked for a lager on tap she didn't know what beers were a lager

Then took a long time to make my Campari -

Very disappointing as I was a bar girl and found that very odd.

Having said that, my bestie and I still enjoyed a few quiet hours and left as DJ harked up the music and the crowd changed

title: Awesome and inspirational
text:
Friend suggested we went here as they had been before. I was hesitant when I saw a long queue as I dint queue to eat. Ever.

So Jason got our names down for a table of 3 and was handed a vibrating device to notify us when table was ready.

We then wandered the grounds and I was quietly impressed. The small stalls offered a variety of tasty treats or drinks. The other cafes weren't open but looked amazing. The market was OK.

We bought take ways coffees at a stall.

We then were buzzed and made our way to the cafe and table. My friends had breakfast burger I had the Bircher muesli with fresh berries. It was lovely

The presentation for the chai latte was memorable and tasty

I have already recommended friends to visit the grounds of Alexandria so you must go

title: Everyone should do this at least once
text:
Such an amazing event with high energy even if you walk it.

Well organised and the 14 kms is entertaining and great views

Always great weather

Will be back again next year

title: Overrated
text:
Service was appallingly slow and the barman almost had the attitude of "you should be grateful I am serving you"

It was awful. And there are plenty of rooftop bars in Sydney with views and better service

I would never recommend anyone to go. I actually would suggest don't go.

title: Love love these
text:
Been before to SF and on cable cars before but had to go again.

Worth the cost - even get a day pass I think USD17 would be worth it.

Having said this - we caught the car at 7am so no crowds which added to the charm. Conductor chatty too

Got of at Lombard St - walked down and back up, caught car again at top of Lombard St - gorgeous

Love these and you should all go for a ride - try to avoid the crowds and get up early.
place: Powell and Market Cable Car Turnaround

title: Great fish and chips
text:
Sourdough batter and freshly battered - yum. Chips great too.

Chowder looked extremely popular.

Windy sunny cold day and even eating inside was cold due to wind. Only downside

Restrooms line far too long and found rest of viewing irritable so left the pier - but great fish and chips
